div.p: P79/8897, unit 1099, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

note.p: Data entered by G. Luehmann and signed by M.

div.p: To the Honorable the Chief Secretary

I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the two months
two months
over
Quarter
struck through .
ending 31st October 1879.

Paper for Lithograms
Line struck through.

border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-right: 0.0208in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p:
Towards Flora Australiensis
Line struck through; the final volume had been published in 1878. M to G. Berry, 7 September 1878, requested funds for a supplement, or an abridged but supplemented edition, which was approved as an abridged Flora (see M to G. Berry, 3 January 1879). A sum of £125 was included in the vote for the Government Botanist 'Towards the publication of an edition of the Flora Australiensis, approved on 28 January 1880 (Victoria,
Votes and Proceedings of the Legislative Assembly, Session 1879-80 , p. 239). However, in M to W. Odgers, 27 September 1879, M requested, if permitted by the Audit Act, to use this amount for 'employment of a collector or purchase of plants purposely collected'. He asked the same question in M to G. Berry, 24 January 1880. Although replies have not been found, it appears as if M had already spent some of the amount in this way, but could not continue to do so.
